page.title: 02TRAFFIC ON THE B1190
page.content: We conducted a{traffic census}on Tuesday 4th June 1985. The road that we conducted the survey on was the {B1190}Lincoln to Horncastle bus route. The weather was fine but there was a slight drizzle from 2pm until the end of school at 3pm. At 1pm the shop closed which may have influenced the rate of pedestrians and cyclists coming past the school from 1pm onwards. Meanwhile as this was going on the farmers were making good use of the hot weather to cut and transport silage. In the 5 and a half hours that we conducted our census, we counted 211 cars, 101 lorries, 2 horses, 7 cyclists, 13 tractors, 6 motor cycles, 4 buses and 15 pedestrians. The average number of cars which passed the school in an hour was 66. Quiet periods were at dinnertime and early afternoon.
